title: Will Campbell ready to return to Patriots after ‘miserable’ stint on injured reserve
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “It obviously isn’t fun, but it’s a part of this game.
And just tried to attack the rehab process and get better.
” Will Campbell returned to practice on Wednesday.

title: How Drake Maye, Patriots players reacted to news of Diggs, Barmore’s criminal charges
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I'm going to support them any way I can, support my teammates and love those guys.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of criminal charges against Stefon Diggs, Christian Barmore
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I don’t think we have to jump to any sort of conclusions right now.
Let the process take its toll.
” Mike Vrabel fielded questions from the media on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Teen charged in rush-hour assault, group robbery on Orange Line
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Mannice Mitchner was allegedly seen approaching the scene with his cellphone out to record the incident, and prosecutors have accused him of joining the fray.

Carlin Stiehl for The Boston Globe By Abby Patkin December 31, 2025 | 3:27 PM 2 minutes to read A Roxbury teen is facing charges after prosecutors say he filmed a group robbery on the Orange Line earlier this month, eventually joining in and kicking the alleged victim in the head.
Mannice Mitchner, 18, pleaded not guilty Monday to charges of unarmed robbery, assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, and disorderly conduct on a public conveyance.

title: Trump slams Kennedys in wake of JFK’s granddaughter’s death
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Politics In a series of posts, Trump shared screenshots of his supporters questioning the Kennedys’ commitment to the arts and accusing them of “rooting for America and Trump to fail.
” Tatiana Schlossberg, second right, granddaughter of President J.
F.

title: Kraft Group reach agreements with Boston and Everett in pursuit of Revolution soccer stadium
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution "We look forward to continued collaboration with Everett, Boston, and the community as the project advances through local and state review and as we take the many next steps necessary to bring this vision to life.
" Artist's rendering of a proposed New England Revolution soccer stadium along the Mystic River in Everett.

title: After call to help find T ‘deviant,’ MBTA police make an arrest
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Robert McCarty, 49, pleaded not guilty Tuesday to one count of open and gross lewdness.
MBTA Transit Police have arrested and charged a Cambridge man they branded a “deviant” after he allegedly masturbated on a Red Line train outside Harvard Square.
Robert McCarty, 49, pleaded not guilty Tuesday to one count of open and gross lewdness — a felony punishable by up to three years in prison, or two years in jail.
